Row.Text: +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Land Units in this City. Each source of [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RES_COPPER] Copper worked by this City produces +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Discovers a source of [ICON_RES_COPPER] Copper nearby the City upon construction. Only the Celts may build it.

The Celtic unique replacement for the Forge, the Stannary costs no maintenance and is available two techologies sooner (but is not cheaper to construct), providing a very early [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production increase. It also provides a larger [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production bonus to both [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RES_COPPER] Copper and generates a source of [ICON_RES_COPPER] Copper near the City upon construction, if possible.

A stannary is a district that mines and works tin. The first use of tin was in the production of the first known alloy, bronze, which is made from tin and copper and is known from as early as 3000 BC. After 600 BC, pure metallic tin was produced. Pewter, which is an alloy of around 85% tin with the remainder commonly consisting of copper, antimony, and lead, was used for flatware from the Bronze Age until the 20th century. In modern times, tin is used in many alloys, most notably tin/lead soft solders, which are typically 60% or more tin.
